newsitem.title: CHINA: More bank loans for state firms in northeast China.
newsitem.headline: More bank loans for state firms in northeast China.

text.p: The Liaoning branch of the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China has increased loans for state firms by a record 2.1 billion yuan ($253 million) in the first four months, the Xinhua news agency said on Friday.
It did not give a comparative figure or give the value of outstanding loans extended by the bank to state enterprises.
Liaoning, an old industrial base in northeast China, is home to 10 percent of the country's large- and medium-sized state enterprises, many of which are losing money.
The bank had also extended 185 million yuan in loans to coal enterprises to help them clear debts, Xinhua said. It gave no further details.
